results.name: Ways to tile a 5 X (2n+1) floor with tatami mats, including one monomer.
comment: Apart from a single 1 X 1 monomer, the area is tiled with 2 X 1 mats. No four mats are permitted to meet at a point.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,2,-1,-2,-1).
formula: S_3(n) = 2* Sum_{0<=k<=[(n-3)/6]} 2*((n-3)/4-1/2*k)!/(k!*((n-3)/4-3/2*k)!). The sum is over odd k if n==1 (mod 4), else over even k.
G.f. x +14*x^3 +2*x*(1 +2*x^2 +3*x^4 -2*x^6 -4*x^8 -2*x^10)/ (1-x^4-x^6)^2. (Includes zeros for even floor widths).- _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 10 2017
example: For n=0, the 5X1 floor allows the monomer to be placed at one of the two ends or in the middle: a(n=0)=3.
program: a(n)=s1(n) + s3(n) + s5(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 20 2017
xref: Cf. A271786 [3X(2n+1) floor]. 2nd column of A272474.
